headline: Darden price target raised to $205 from $195 at BTIG
summary: BTIG raised the firm’s price target on Darden (DRI) to $205 from $195 and keeps a Buy rating on the shares after its Q2 results. The company’s sales were better than expected, and its management has multiple levers to achieve full-year guidance, the analyst tells investors in a research note. BTIG adds that Q2 results were “encouraging” though noisy, with calendar shifts and weather disruption clouding some positive sales trends. Published first on TheFly – the ultimate source for real-time, mar

headline: Darden price target raised to $211 from $195 at BofA
summary: BofA raised the firm’s price target on Darden (DRI) to $211 from $195 and keeps a Buy rating on the shares following a Q2 report that the firm says “was a more typical quarter for Darden,” with Olive Garden comps turning positive after being negative for the prior three quarters and Longhorn comps “beating handily.” With the benefits of increased marketing and potential upside from new channels, the firm expects Olive Garden comps to remain positive in the second half of FY25, the analyst added.

headline: What Moved Markets This Week
summary: Wall Street suffered its worst weekly loss in over a month on Friday on Fed comments after another rate cut. Read more about this week's major events on Wall Street.

headline: Darden Restaurants: Improved Outlook, But Valuation Don't Look Cheap (Rating Upgrade To Hold)
summary: I upgrade Darden Restaurants (DRI) from sell to hold, recognizing its ability to thrive in a tough promotional environment and maintain strong margins.
